parameters.description: Include results for the specified round. For performance reasons, this parameter may be disabled on some configurations.
parameters.name: round

parameters.description: Filter just assets with the given creator address.
parameters.name: creator

parameters.description: Filter just assets with the given name.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Filter just assets with the given unit.
parameters.name: unit

get.description: Lookup the list of accounts who hold this asset

Account.description:
Account information at a given round.

Definition:
data/basics/userBalance.go : AccountData

amount.description: \[algo\] total number of MicroAlgos in the account

amount-without-pending-rewards.description: specifies the amount of MicroAlgos in the account, without the pending rewards.

apps-local-state.description:
\[appl\] applications local data stored in this account.

Note the raw object uses `map[int] -> AppLocalState` for this type.

apps-total-schema.description:
\[tsch\] stores the sum of all of the local schemas and global schemas in this account.

Note: the raw account uses `StateSchema` for this type.

assets.description:
\[asset\] assets held by this account.

Note the raw object uses `map[int] -> AssetHolding` for this type.

created-apps.description:
\[appp\] parameters of applications created by this account including app global data.

Note: the raw account uses `map[int] -> AppParams` for this type.

created-assets.description:
\[apar\] parameters of assets created by this account.

Note: the raw account uses `map[int] -> Asset` for this type.

pending-rewards.description: amount of MicroAlgos of pending rewards in this account.

reward-base.description: \[ebase\] used as part of the rewards computation. Only applicable to accounts which are participating.

rewards.description: \[ern\] total rewards of MicroAlgos the account has received, including pending rewards.

round.description: The round for which this information is relevant.

status.description:
\[onl\] delegation status of the account's MicroAlgos
* Offline - indicates that the associated account is delegated.
*  Online  - indicates that the associated account used as part of the delegation pool.
*   NotParticipating - indicates that the associated account is neither a delegator nor a delegate.

sig-type.description:
Indicates what type of signature is used by this account, must be one of:
* sig
* msig
* lsig

auth-addr.description: \[spend\] the address against which signing should be checked. If empty, the address of the current account is used. This field can be updated in any transaction by setting the RekeyTo field.

AccountParticipation.description: AccountParticipation describes the parameters used by this account in consensus protocol.

selection-participation-key.description: \[sel\] Selection public key (if any) currently registered for this round.

vote-first-valid.description: \[voteFst\] First round for which this participation is valid.

vote-key-dilution.description: \[voteKD\] Number of subkeys in each batch of participation keys.

vote-last-valid.description: \[voteLst\] Last round for which this participation is valid.

vote-participation-key.description: \[vote\] root participation public key (if any) currently registered for this round.

ApplicationStateSchema.description: Specifies maximums on the number of each type that may be stored.

ApplicationLocalState.description: Stores local state associated with an application.

id.description: The application which this local state is for.

TealKeyValueStore.description: Represents a key-value store for use in an application.

TealKeyValue.description: Represents a key-value pair in an application store.

ApplicationParams.description: Stores the global information associated with an application.

creator.description: The address that created this application. This is the address where the parameters and global state for this application can be found.

Asset.description: Specifies both the unique identifier and the parameters for an asset

AssetHolding.description:
Describes an asset held by an account.

Definition:
data/basics/userBalance.go : AssetHolding

creator.description: Address that created this asset. This is the address where the parameters for this asset can be found, and also the address where unwanted asset units can be sent in the worst case.

is-frozen.description: \[f\] whether or not the holding is frozen.

AssetParams.description:
AssetParams specifies the parameters for an asset.

\[apar\] when part of an AssetConfig transaction.

Definition:
data/transactions/asset.go : AssetParams

clawback.description: \[c\] Address of account used to clawback holdings of this asset.  If empty, clawback is not permitted.

creator.description: The address that created this asset. This is the address where the parameters for this asset can be found, and also the address where unwanted asset units can be sent in the worst case.

decimals.description: \[dc\] The number of digits to use after the decimal point when displaying this asset. If 0, the asset is not divisible. If 1, the base unit of the asset is in tenths. If 2, the base unit of the asset is in hundredths, and so on. This value must be between 0 and 19 (inclusive).

default-frozen.description: \[df\] Whether holdings of this asset are frozen by default.

freeze.description: \[f\] Address of account used to freeze holdings of this asset.  If empty, freezing is not permitted.

manager.description: \[m\] Address of account used to manage the keys of this asset and to destroy it.

metadata-hash.description: \[am\] A commitment to some unspecified asset metadata. The format of this metadata is up to the application.

name.description: \[an\] Name of this asset, as supplied by the creator.

reserve.description: \[r\] Address of account holding reserve (non-minted) units of this asset.

total.description: \[t\] The total number of units of this asset.

unit-name.description: \[un\] Name of a unit of this asset, as supplied by the creator.

url.description: \[au\] URL where more information about the asset can be retrieved.

genesis-hash.description: \[gh\] hash to which this block belongs.

genesis-id.description: \[gen\] ID to which this block belongs.

round.description: \[rnd\] Current round on which this block was appended to the chain.

timestamp.description: \[ts\] Block creation timestamp in seconds since eposh

transactions.description: \[txns\] list of transactions corresponding to a given round.

transactions-root.description: \[txn\] TransactionsRoot authenticates the set of transactions appearing in the block. More specifically, it's the root of a merkle tree whose leaves are the block's Txids, in lexicographic order. For the empty block, it's 0. Note that the TxnRoot does not authenticate the signatures on the transactions, only the transactions themselves. Two blocks with the same transactions but in a different order and with different signatures will have the same TxnRoot.

txn-counter.description:
\[tc\] TxnCounter counts the number of transactions committed in the ledger, from the time at which support for this feature was introduced.

Specifically, TxnCounter is the number of the next transaction that will be committed after this block.  It is 0 when no transactions have ever been committed (since TxnCounter started being supported).

fee-sink.description: \[fees\] accepts transaction fees, it can only spend to the incentive pool.

rewards-calculation-round.description: \[rwcalr\] number of leftover MicroAlgos after the distribution of rewards-rate MicroAlgos for every reward unit in the next round.

rewards-level.description: \[earn\] How many rewards, in MicroAlgos, have been distributed to each RewardUnit of MicroAlgos since genesis.

rewards-pool.description: \[rwd\] accepts periodic injections from the fee-sink and continually redistributes them as rewards.

rewards-rate.description: \[rate\] Number of new MicroAlgos added to the participation stake from rewards at the next round.

rewards-residue.description: \[frac\] Number of leftover MicroAlgos after the distribution of RewardsRate/rewardUnits MicroAlgos for every reward unit in the next round.

BlockUpgradeState.description: Fields relating to a protocol upgrade.

next-protocol-approvals.description: \[nextyes\] Number of blocks which approved the protocol upgrade.

next-protocol-switch-on.description: \[nextswitch\] Round on which the protocol upgrade will take effect.

next-protocol-vote-before.description: \[nextbefore\] Deadline round for this protocol upgrade (No votes will be consider after this round).

BlockUpgradeVote.description: Fields relating to voting for a protocol upgrade.

upgrade-approve.description: \[upgradeyes\] Indicates a yes vote for the current proposal.

upgrade-delay.description: \[upgradedelay\] Indicates the time between acceptance and execution.

ErrorResponse.description: An error response with optional data field.

OnCompletion.description:
\[apan\] defines the what additional actions occur with the transaction.

Valid types:
* noop
* optin
* closeout
* clear
* update
* update
* delete

StateSchema.description: Represents a \[apls\] local-state or \[apgs\] global-state schema. These schemas determine how much storage may be used in a local-state or global-state for an application. The more space used, the larger minimum balance must be maintained in the account holding the data.

num-uint.description: Maximum number of TEAL uints that may be stored in the key/value store.

num-byte-slice.description: Maximum number of TEAL byte slices that may be stored in the key/value store.

Transaction.description:
Contains all fields common to all transactions and serves as an envelope to all transactions type.

Definition:
data/transactions/signedtxn.go : SignedTxn
data/transactions/transaction.go : Transaction

auth-addr.description: \[sgnr\] this is included with signed transactions when the signing address does not equal the sender. The backend can use this to ensure that auth addr is equal to the accounts auth addr.

confirmed-round.description: Round when the transaction was confirmed.

created-application-index.description: Specifies an application index (ID) if an application was created with this transaction.

created-asset-index.description: Specifies an asset index (ID) if an asset was created with this transaction.

first-valid.description: \[fv\] First valid round for this transaction.

group.description: \[grp\] Base64 encoded byte array of a sha512/256 digest. When present indicates that this transaction is part of a transaction group and the value is the sha512/256 hash of the transactions in that group.

intra-round-offset.description: Offset into the round where this transaction was confirmed.

last-valid.description: \[lv\] Last valid round for this transaction.

lease.description: \[lx\] Base64 encoded 32-byte array. Lease enforces mutual exclusion of transactions.  If this field is nonzero, then once the transaction is confirmed, it acquires the lease identified by the (Sender, Lease) pair of the transaction until the LastValid round passes.  While this transaction possesses the lease, no other transaction specifying this lease can be confirmed.

rekey-to.description: \[rekey\] when included in a valid transaction, the accounts auth addr will be updated with this value and future signatures must be signed with the key represented by this address.

round-time.description: Time when the block this transaction is in was confirmed.

tx-type.description:
\[type\] Indicates what type of transaction this is. Different types have different fields.

Valid types, and where their fields are stored:
* \[pay\] payment-transaction
* \[keyreg\] keyreg-transaction
* \[acfg\] asset-config-transaction
* \[axfer\] asset-transfer-transaction
* \[afrz\] asset-freeze-transaction
* \[appl\] application-transaction

auth-addr.description: \[sgnr\] The address used to sign the transaction. This is used for rekeyed accounts to indicate that the sender address did not sign the transaction.

local-state-delta.description: \[ld\] Local state key/value changes for the application being executed by this transaction.

global-state-delta.description: \[gd\] Global state key/value changes for the application being executed by this transaction.

TransactionApplication.description:
Fields for application transactions.

Definition:
data/transactions/application.go : ApplicationCallTxnFields

application-id.description: \[apid\] ID of the application being configured or empty if creating.

application-args.description: \[apaa\] transaction specific arguments accessed from the application's approval-program and clear-state-program.

accounts.description: \[apat\] List of accounts in addition to the sender that may be accessed from the application's approval-program and clear-state-program.

foreign-apps.description: \[apfa\] Lists the applications in addition to the application-id whose global states may be accessed by this application's approval-program and clear-state-program. The access is read-only.

foreign-assets.description: \[apas\] lists the assets whose parameters may be accessed by this application's ApprovalProgram and ClearStateProgram. The access is read-only.

approval-program.description: \[apap\] Logic executed for every application transaction, except when on-completion is set to "clear". It can read and write global state for the application, as well as account-specific local state. Approval programs may reject the transaction.

clear-state-program.description: \[apsu\] Logic executed for application transactions with on-completion set to "clear". It can read and write global state for the application, as well as account-specific local state. Clear state programs cannot reject the transaction.

TransactionAssetConfig.description:
Fields for asset allocation, re-configuration, and destruction.


A zero value for asset-id indicates asset creation.
A zero value for the params indicates asset destruction.

Definition:
data/transactions/asset.go : AssetConfigTxnFields

asset-id.description: \[xaid\] ID of the asset being configured or empty if creating.

TransactionAssetFreeze.description:
Fields for an asset freeze transaction.

Definition:
data/transactions/asset.go : AssetFreezeTxnFields

address.description: \[fadd\] Address of the account whose asset is being frozen or thawed.

asset-id.description: \[faid\] ID of the asset being frozen or thawed.

TransactionAssetTransfer.description:
Fields for an asset transfer transaction.

Definition:
data/transactions/asset.go : AssetTransferTxnFields

amount.description: \[aamt\] Amount of asset to transfer. A zero amount transferred to self allocates that asset in the account's Assets map.

asset-id.description: \[xaid\] ID of the asset being transferred.

close-amount.description: Number of assets transfered to the close-to account as part of the transaction.

close-to.description: \[aclose\] Indicates that the asset should be removed from the account's Assets map, and specifies where the remaining asset holdings should be transferred.  It's always valid to transfer remaining asset holdings to the creator account.

sender.description: \[asnd\] The effective sender during a clawback transactions. If this is not a zero value, the real transaction sender must be the Clawback address from the AssetParams.

TransactionKeyreg.description:
Fields for a keyreg transaction.

Definition:
data/transactions/keyreg.go : KeyregTxnFields

non-participation.description: \[nonpart\] Mark the account as participating or non-participating.

selection-participation-key.description: \[selkey\] Public key used with the Verified Random Function (VRF) result during committee selection.

vote-first-valid.description: \[votefst\] First round this participation key is valid.

vote-key-dilution.description: \[votekd\] Number of subkeys in each batch of participation keys.

vote-last-valid.description: \[votelst\] Last round this participation key is valid.

vote-participation-key.description: \[votekey\] Participation public key used in key registration transactions.

TransactionPayment.description:
Fields for a payment transaction.

Definition:
data/transactions/payment.go : PaymentTxnFields

amount.description: \[amt\] number of MicroAlgos intended to be transferred.

close-amount.description: Number of MicroAlgos that were sent to the close-remainder-to address when closing the sender account.

close-remainder-to.description: \[close\] when set, indicates that the sending account should be closed and all remaining funds be transferred to this address.

TransactionSignature.description: Validation signature associated with some data. Only one of the signatures should be provided.

logic.description: \[l\] Program signed by a signature or multi signature, or hashed to be the address of ana ccount. Base64 encoded TEAL program.

TransactionSignatureMultisig.description:
\[msig\] structure holding multiple subsignatures.

Definition:
crypto/multisig.go : MultisigSig

subsignature.description: \[subsig\] holds pairs of public key and signatures.

address.description: Only include transactions with this address in one of the transaction fields.
address.name: address

address-role.description: Combine with the address parameter to define what type of address to search for.
address-role.name: address-role

after-time.description: Include results after the given time. Must be an RFC 3339 formatted string.
after-time.name: after-time

before-time.description: Include results before the given time. Must be an RFC 3339 formatted string.
before-time.name: before-time

currency-greater-than.description: Results should have an amount greater than this value. MicroAlgos are the default currency unless an asset-id is provided, in which case the asset will be used.
currency-greater-than.name: currency-greater-than

currency-less-than.description: Results should have an amount less than this value. MicroAlgos are the default currency unless an asset-id is provided, in which case the asset will be used.
currency-less-than.name: currency-less-than

exclude-close-to.description: Combine with address and address-role parameters to define what type of address to search for. The close to fields are normally treated as a receiver, if you would like to exclude them set this parameter to true.
exclude-close-to.name: exclude-close-to

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return.
limit.name: limit

max-round.description: Include results at or before the specified max-round.
max-round.name: max-round

min-round.description: Include results at or after the specified min-round.
min-round.name: min-round

next.description: The next page of results. Use the next token provided by the previous results.
next.name: next

note-prefix.description: Specifies a prefix which must be contained in the note field.
note-prefix.name: note-prefix

rekey-to.description: Include results which include the rekey-to field.
rekey-to.name: rekey-to

round.description: Include results for the specified round.
round.name: round

sig-type.description:
SigType filters just results using the specified type of signature:
* sig - Standard
* msig - MultiSig
* lsig - LogicSig
sig-type.name: sig-type

auth-addr.description: Include accounts configured to use this spending key.
auth-addr.name: auth-addr

txid.description: Lookup the specific transaction by ID.
txid.name: txid

current-round.description: Round at which the results were computed.
Round at which the results were computed.

next-token.description: Used for pagination, when making another request provide this token with the next parameter.

current-round.description: Round at which the results were computed.

next-token.description: Used for pagination, when making another request provide this token with the next parameter.

current-round.description: Round at which the results were computed.
Round at which the results were computed.

next-token.description: Used for pagination, when making another request provide this token with the next parameter.

current-round.description: Round at which the results were computed.
Round at which the results were computed.

next-token.description: Used for pagination, when making another request provide this token with the next parameter.

current-round.description: Round at which the results were computed.
Round at which the results were computed.

next-token.description: Used for pagination, when making another request provide this token with the next parameter.
